questions.question: Both his parents …………………….. when he was sixteen.
questions.description: Died is the past tense of die.

questions.question: The doctors declared him ……………………….. on arrival.
questions.description: Dead is an adjective. Died is a verb.

questions.question: She ……………………….. in
questions.description: The simple past is used when we say when something happened.

questions.question: Whenever we meet we ……………………….. politics.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that are not followed by a preposition.

questions.question: If you have time, I will gladly ………………………… a visit.
questions.description: The expression pay someone a visit is the standard.

questions.question: She said that she had …………………………..
questions.description: Paid is the past and past participle of pay.

questions.question: I am looking forward ………………………….. from you.
questions.description: We use to + ing form/noun after look/looking forward.

questions.question: How intelligent ………………………..!
questions.description: The inverted word order is used in exclamations.

questions.question: Tell me what ………………………….. doing there.
questions.description: The inverted word order is used in indirect questions.

questions.question: You ……………………… give me my money back.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice or warnings.

questions.question: If you went there, you …………………….. dead now.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If you do that again, I ………………………… kill you.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.
